rsn: By comparing the two images, we can observe that the objects in the target image (the second image) appear slightly shifted downward compared to their positions in the source image (the first image). This indicates that the camera has moved upward, as the upward movement of the camera would cause the objects in the scene to appear lower in the frame. Additionally, the ceiling and upper parts of the walls are more visible in the target image, further supporting the idea of an upward translation.
label: down
